title: St John Fisher Catholic High School, Wigan
text:
St John Fisher Catholic High School is a mixed comprehensive secondary school in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a>, <a href="Greater%20Manchester">Greater Manchester</a>, England. It is named after the <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Catholic</a> <a href="martyr">martyr</a> <a href="John%20Fisher">John Fisher</a>.
Academics.
The schools performs well in league tables compared with other local schools. It was among the top five performing schools in the Wigan <a href="Local%20Education%20Authority">LEA</a> in the 2011 <a href="GCSE">GCSE</a>s.
Performing arts.
During November 2007, the school put on "<a href="High%20School%20Musical">High School Musical</a>" with a cast drawn from the higher-school and lower-school. The 2008 production was 'Striking Out' which was the school's version of "<a href="Billy%20Elliot">Billy Elliot</a>". For the 2009 show extracts from "Annie", "Oliver Twist" and "Les Miserables" were combined with talent acts to create a 2-hour show called "Musical Montage".
Sport.
The school has been associated with <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> since the 1970s. In the late 1990s and early 2000s, one year's team went unbeaten for five years, earning a place in the Guinness Book of Records. The school has produced notable alumni, including <a href="Shaun%20Edwards">Shaun Edwards</a>, the late Billy Joe Edwards, <a href="Sean%20Gleeson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Sean Gleeson</a> and <a href="Chris%20Ashton">Chris Ashton</a>.
